H0.text: At the bottom of the highest hill is the point at which the front car of the roller coaster will most likely have its greatest potential energy.

H1.text: At the top of the highest hill, the front car of the roller coaster will most likely have its greatest potential energy.

H2.text: At the start of the track, the front car of the roller coaster will most likely have its greatest potential energy as it climbs the highest hill on its track.

H3.text: At the end of the track, the front car of the roller coaster will most likely have its greatest potential energy while climbing the highest hill.

A4.text: Roller coasters use chains to move a car up an incline, building up gravitational potential energy

A5.text: The amount of gravitational potential energy held by an elevated object is equal to the work done against gravity in lifting it
